info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 22 at 12:54AM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A period of snow over the next few hours will be changing to a wintry mix and eventually plain rain for the late night hours... According to spotter reports and web cam imagery, steady moderate snowfall is occurring for the Connecticut River Valley of southeastern Vermont. Visibility is being reduced to under one mile with the moderate snowfall. Some sleet and freezing rain will begin mixing in with the snow over the next few hours, with a transition over to plain rain by the late night hours. Before that occurs, 1 to 3 inches of snow is expected to accumulate, especially on untreated surfaces. With this snowfall, slippery travel can be expected on many roadways. Travelers are encouraged to slow down, use caution and allow extra distance between vehicles.
